data.value: Hey, you know, you could use that cooler of yours to transport Bopo's snow down from the mountain!
Alright, give me a second...
Great, that should keep it cold for Bopo. I'll be sure to give it to him if we ever find ourselves back in Mudpot.
You'd do that?
This can't all just be a coincidence - the attacks on the surface, your wells drying up... I'm certain this "Lady" must know something about what's going on.
But that still doesn't excuse you from puttin' yourself in danger like that! I may not be able to help your father, but I sure as heck ain't gonna lose you, too!
Momma...
I wonder if those monster attacks on the surface could be related to your wells drying up.

I wouldn't be at all surprised. It's been a couple weeks since the water dried up, but every creature here is feelin' the effects. I'll bet those creatures broke through to the surface lookin' for more water!
Momma, maybe these two can go talk to the Lady!
The Lady?

Oh, she's a sweet old soul - lives deep in the caves, makes the waters flow. She doesn't show herself 'round here too often, and we can't actually go see her on account of all the nasties livin' between here an' there.
In that case, I'll go speak with this "Lady" and see why she's stopped the flow of water.
Well then, I had you folks pegged all wrong! If you aim to help my husband, I promise not to clock you with my wooden spoon 'a justice.
So, you're heading down to talk to the Lady now? You'll help my Pa?
Um... Thanks?
You got my word!
We'll do our best, Bopo. Just don't go running off again.
Attacked a surface village, you say? Well, if that don't beat all! We underground folk tend to keep to ourselves - got enough problems of our own already.
I'm sorry to hear that.
Huh? What're they talking 'bout, Bopo?
Um, well... they have been following me for a while.
Back! Back you beasts! I got this 'ere spoon and I ain't afraid to use it!
We aren't here for trouble, ma'am. In fact, we just saved your son.
Do I look like some country bumpkin to you? A'course you're from the surface! I think I'd remember seein' a talkin', flyin' weasel-cat thing down 'ere!
I think we got off on the wrong foot here. My name is Dust, and this is Fidget. Some creatures attacked a village above these caves, and we're trying to figure out why.
What!? How far out did you go!? I may just save the spoon for you!
I'm sorry, we just came down from the surface to-
Well, our healing wells have gone and run dry, and my Pa's done gotten real sick. That's why I went out, to find some more of that water.
I hate sayin' it, but it's true. See these mud pots lyin' 'round? Normally they're bubblin' to the brim with mineral water, but just a few weeks ago, they dried up to nothin'.
Wait!
Actually what I'm sayin' is, we got enough problems of our own without you surface-folk bringin' all that nonsense down here. So, if you don't mind...
That's enough, Bopo! You ought get back to your chores before I take out the spoon again!
Stop saying that! Pa's gonna die if we don't do something!
C'mon Dust, we're obviously not wanted here.
Momma, I seen 'em fight. They even got themselves a talking sword! I bet they could help!
Die? What's going on?
Young man, I don't care if their sword spouts rainbows and bowls 'a delicious baked beans, I don't want their help!
How'd they jump my fence!? Crafty vermin, those surface-dwellers!
Your father's done gonna have himself a heart-attack after he hears about this!
I'm sorry, momma.
Goodness, what would I do if you'd gotten yourself hurt!?
Ahh! Momma, look! Those things must've followed me!
She does see that I can fly, right?
I'll be sure to tell her, Fidget. I'm sure that'll clear things right up.
There he is!
You'll save my Pa, won't ya? Please, Dust! You gotta help him!
A wise choice. A night's rest will clear your head.
Wise words, Fidget. Dust, your past is fractured and your future is not yet written, but you have traveled through this world as a beacon of good, and that is all that matters.
I'm sorry, Fidget. I didn't mean to-
You're both right. I'm worrying so much about who I was that I've been blind to the good I've done as Dust. Anyway, it's late. We should find a place to sleep.
And just what IS the perfect time and place? How many more have to die before you tell me who I am!? Who am I, Ahrah? What am I even doing here!?
The village needed its water supply. I would have gone to the Lady either way.
What does that mean? Why is it that every time I make a decision you treat it like some kind of test? What haven't you told me, Ahrah?
This is not the time, nor the place.
Then it doesn't matter what I knew. And it is why there is hope for you, yet, Dust.
And stop worrying about who you are! You're Dust! You hear me? I don't care who you were, I don't even care if you used to work with that General guy, because you're DUST now!
That doesn't excuse this, Ahrah. Did you know? Did you know we'd be too late?
Stop yelling! Just... please, please stop. I can't take this right now. We did the best we could, Dust. We did the best we could.
I don't understand... we got the water running. We did everything we were supposed to.
If I'd told you before, would you still have tried to save him?
Fidget, it's like what Bopo's mother said: when the Life Thread calls for you, you must go. He was fated to pass, and there is nothing we could have done to stop it.
You're a good kid, Bopo. I think your father would be proud.
I think so, too. I also think he's happy I found a friend like you. Thank you, Dust!
Goodbye, Pa. I'll miss ya.
Bopo...
And with these final words, we commit PoPop's essence to the Life Thread, where he joins all who have come and gone, who were, and who have been. We'll be seein' ya, old friend.
Goodbye, my love.
Naw, you did plenty. You showed me what it means to be strong, even when the world's against ya.
Pa's gone now, so I gotta be strong for Momma. Strong like you!
Thank you Dust. Without you, we wouldn't have any water. You saved Mudpot!
I only wish I could've done more.
I'm sorry, Bopo, but I have to go now. I have to get back to the surface, to make sure this doesn't happen ever again.
... I promise.
I can't...
You'll come back, though, right? You gotta make sure you come back!
Momma? What is it, Momma?
We came back as soon as we could. Where is your mother?
Bopo, darlin'... please come inside.
Dust! Look! The water's runnin'! Ya did it!
She's inside with Pa! Once the water started flowin' again, she brought it right in for 'im! Oh, look, here she comes now! Momma, look they're here! I told ya they'd get the water runnin' again!
Pa!? Pa, no! You can't go! Dust got the water runnin'! He did!
He held on long as he could... but it just weren't enough.
But... we got the water running...
I'm sorry, sweetheart, I truly am. He was such a fighter. It was... it was just his time. An' when it comes, there ain't nothin' you can do.

Dust, you stop that moanin' right this instant! You did what you could - you did more than anyone, an' for that you deserve all our thanks. You could'a gotten the water runnin' days ago, but I think the hurt was just too hard on him.
Damn it! We weren't fast enough!
We... we failed, Fidget. We weren't fast enough.
Master, let's give them a moment alone.
Pa? Didn't you hear? They got the water runnin'! Pa!? PA!?
I've just gotta be strong now, for Momma. Thanks so much, Dust. For everythin'.
We'll bring you your snow, Bopo.
Thank you, Dust. It'd mean so much to Pa.
Are you okay, Bopo? Is there anything I can do?
What is it?
It just doesn't seem real. Pa's gone, and I wish...
Not unless I help him! Dust, do you think... somehow... you could try an' get me some snow? I think Pa would really appreciate it...
Well, I wish I could give him a proper send-off, you know? My whole life he'd been tellin' me about visitin' those snowy mountains on the surface... and now he'll never get to see it.
Thank you, Dust! Oh, thanks so much!
Of course, Bopo. I understand. When I'm in the mountains, I'll remember to bring you back some snow. Promise.
This is important to him, Fidget. We'll find a way.
Honestly Dust? Snow? How do you intend on keeping it cold?
We had our moment together, me an' Pa. Takin' a walk through the snow, buildin' a fort, watchin' all those flakes fall from the sky...
I know none of it were real, but I'll always have this memory now, thanks to you.
Well, I don't have much to offer, 'sides from this funny rock. It don't seem to do anythin' down here in Mudpot, but it looks pretty neat! Here, it's all yours!
Dust, you did it! You brought snow!
Thanks Bopo.
I know how much it means to you, Bopo.
